title: Baby Carrier (mei Tai), 1950–2000
medium:
Medium: cotton embroidery on cotton foundation, rattan? 
Technique: appliquéd and embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave
Label: indigo-dyed cotton, appliquéd and embroidered with cotton in cross stitch
provenance: Purchased by the dealer, Dennis Kord, from a Miao woman in Guizhou.
dimensions:
H x W (without straps): 69.5 x 51.4 cm (27 3/8 x 20 1/4 in.)
H x W (with straps): 69.5 x 332.7 cm (27 3/8 in. x 10 ft. 11 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Baby carrier with an upper rectangular section stiffened with a reed mat, and a soft lower square, with long tying straps. The upper section is of blackish-blue cotton with red cotton appliqué around the outside and forming three squares, all filled with fine embroidered geometric pattern in white. The lower square and straps are indigo blue, embroidered all over with a diamond grid of fine white cross-stitch embroidery in geometric and floral forms. Back lined with several pieces of indigo-dyed cotton in varied shades. Straps lined with undyed cotton.

tombstone.epitaph:
Baby Carrier (mei Tai), 1950–2000.

Technique: appliquéd and embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave
Label: indigo-dyed cotton, appliquéd and embroidered with cotton in cross stitch. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2012-6-1.
